text:
Raskolnikov entered, struggling not to laugh. 

Razumihin followed, awkward and blushing. 

Raskolnikov bowed to Porfiry Petrovitch. 

“Nice to meet you,” he stammered, fighting back laughter. 

He glanced at Razumihin and lost control. 

Laughter erupted, filling the room. 

Razumihin, furious, shouted, “Fool! You fiend!” 

His arm knocked over a table. 

Tea-glasses shattered everywhere. 

“Why break chairs, gentlemen?” Porfiry asked, bemused. 

Raskolnikov laughed harder, the tension fading.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov struggles to contain his laughter at Razumihin's awkwardness during their entrance into Porfiry Petrovitch's room.
